description: As global temperatures continue to rise, countries in South Asia have experienced increasingly severe heat waves that pose unique challenges to workers—both indoors and outdoors—in the tropical belt.
title: Extreme heat in South Asia challenges worker performances

description: Richard Branson already saw the blackness of space traveling at nearly Mach 3 with his company Virgin Galactic. Now he's going to take a slower approach.
title: Billionaire Richard Branson invests in Space Perspective, to fly on its 1st human space balloon flight

description: A pair of engineers and a historian have teamed up together to model the means by which the first use of the wheel may have happened. In their paper published in Royal Society Open Science, Lee Alacoque, from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, Kai James, with the Georgia Institute of Technology, and Richard Bulliet, from Columbia University, all in the U.S., describe the process that may have unfolded as workers at a copper mine in the Carpathian Mountains sought to move ore more easily from deep within a mine approximately 6,000 years ago.
title: Researchers model how the first use of the wheel may have developed

description: The weeks around Halloween in California usually bring cooler weather, Christmas decorations appearing in stores, leaves to rake and umbrellas opening for the first time since spring.
title: How full are California's reservoirs heading into the winter rainy season?

description: For more than a week straight, photographers, scientists and adventure seekers alike have captured dazzling images of an electric blue light emitting from Southern California's waves at night.
title: Southern California's bioluminescent waves are back: It may not be too late to see the electric blue nights

description: Elections today can generate a lot of noise. The rise of digital media means that, in addition to 24-hour cable news, social media features prominently in campaigns and elections.
title: Research sheds light on how the 2016, 2020 elections were won, lost—and the 'critical' role disinformation played

description: A study published in The Astrophysical Journal presents new simulation results of supernova explosions that explain the latest observational data from the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST).
title: Astronomers use JWST to study hydrodynamics and nucleosynthesis of jet-driven supernovae

description: A team of researchers has for the first time successfully used lasers to generate guided sound waves on the surface of a microchip. These acoustic waves, akin to the surface waves produced during an earthquake, travel across the chip at frequencies nearly a billion times higher than those found in earth tremors.
title: New microchip design harnesses sound waves on the surface for advanced sensing technologies

description: Using the Purple Mountain Observatory (PMO), Chinese astronomers have observed a mid-infrared interstellar bubble known as N59. They detected multiple cloud-cloud collisions that may be behind star formation processes in this bubble. The findings were published October 17 on the pre-print server arXiv.
title: Astronomers observe cloud-cloud collisions in the interstellar bubble N59

description: Images of coastal houses being carried off into the sea due to eroding coastlines and powerful storm surges are becoming more commonplace as climate change brings a rising sea level coupled with more powerful storms. In the U.S. alone, coastal storms caused $165 billion in losses in 2022.
title: Modeling study shows that marshes provide cost-effective coastal protection

description: Researchers from Nagoya University Institute of Transformative Biomolecules (WPI-ITbM) in Japan and their colleagues have identified and derivatized a chemical compound that effectively regulates the density of stomata in model plants. Stomata are crucial for water regulation.
title: New chemical treatment reduces number of plant pores that regulate water loss

description: Animal tracking studies for ecology and conservation all face technological limitations, such as high costs or the need for tags to remain in close proximity to detectors. In research published in Methods in Ecology and Evolution, investigators describe a solution that can overcome many current limitations by employing the massive global network of personal mobile phones as gateways for tracking animals using Bluetooth low energy beacons.
title: Mobile phone networks and Bluetooth technology could help researchers improve animal tracking

description: Woodland caribou populations in Canada are declining because of habitat changes that benefit common prey species of wolves (such as moose and deer), leading to increasing numbers of wolves that kill caribou. To protect caribou, wildlife managers have reduced wolf numbers in some caribou ranges, but this may cause moose populations to grow, resulting in a wolf rebound.
title: Reducing moose numbers could help protect Canadian caribou populations from wolf predation

description: In research published in the British Journal of Social Psychology, investigators have examined the relationship between countries' parental leave policies and young adults' perceptions of social norms for the division of childcare duties between mothers and fathers.
title: Availability of parental leave may affect social norms on gender division of childcare

description: Long term exposure to arsenic in water may increase cardiovascular disease and especially heart disease risk even at exposure levels below the federal regulatory limit (10µg/L) according to a study at Columbia University Mailman School of Public Health.
title: Risk of cardiovascular disease linked to long-term exposure to arsenic in community water supplies
